intro: Gomesa densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered gomesa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gomesa densiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
